intro: Eremogone biebersteinii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb that produces showy yellow flowers, which bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, gray-green foliage that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access moisture from underground sources. Eremogone biebersteinii is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions and is an important part of its local ecosystem.
